title: Greece and Rome - Builders of our world (History Arts).pdf
description:
National Geographic Society | Pdf | Eng | 448 p | 60.2 MB

Jewel-eyed Athena seems almost to stir with life...to push back her crested helm....to hark to Byron as he hymns the majesty of her golden realm. And now that realm of song and myth and history stirs to life again in these 448 color-packed pages. Storied cities shed the dust of millenniums; men and supermen step down from marble pedestals â€” and suddenly you are surrounded by mariners sailing with Odysseus from smoldering Troy on the "sea deep-thundering" to adventure among nymphs and monsters ... by rollicking Athenians swapping wit and wisdom with Socrates at a drinking party they call a symposium . . by triumphant legionaries marching with Caesar into Gaul, Britain, Africa, Asia ... by Romans thirsting for the blood of gladiators and cheering favorites at chariot races where drivers gamble lives for gold
